meanings.definition: A person who abhors or detests something.
meanings.sent1: She is known as one of the abhorrers of horror movies.
meanings.sent2: The abhorrers of spicy food always stick to bland dishes.
meanings.sent3: The abhorrers of early mornings were not thrilled about the sunrise hike.
meanings.sent4: The abhorrers of injustice stood up for what was right.
meanings.sent5: The abhorrers of cruelty could not bear to watch the mistreatment of animals.

meanings.definition: Those who strongly oppose or reject something.
meanings.sent1: The abhorrers of change resisted any new policies at work.
meanings.sent2: Political abhorrers refused to support the controversial bill.
meanings.sent3: The abhorrers of technology still preferred using paper and pen.
meanings.sent4: The abhorrers of violence protested peacefully in the streets.
meanings.sent5: Environmental abhorrers advocated for sustainable practices to protect the planet.
